page.title: 08FISHING-BADLUARACH/SCORAIG
page.content: UNTIL RECENTLY A CREEL-BOAT OPERATED FROM BADLUARACH JETTY,BUT ,APART FROM THE SALMON-FISHING,THERE IS NO LONGER ANY COMMERCIAL FISHING FROM THERE OR SCORAIG,ALTHOUGH TWO CREEL BOATS WORK FROM FURTHER UP LITTLE LOCH BROOM. THE TWO JETTIES ARE USED BY SMALL BOAT-OWNERS ON BOTH SIDES OF THE LOCH FOR LINE-FISHING TRIPS.20 YEARS AGO THERE WAS A MUCH GREATER VARIETY OF FISH,BUT IT WAS OVERFISHED BY TRAWLERS IN THE SIXTIES AND SEVENTIES.NOW,SINCE THE COMING OF LARGE FACTORY SHIPS TO NEARBYE LOCH BROOM,EVEN THE MACKEREL ARE MORE SCARCE.MACKEREL APPEAR NEAR THE END OF JUNE,AND CAN BE CAUGHT RIGHT THROUGH TO THE WINTER.AS WELL AS MACKEREL THERE ARE COAL FISH,POLLACK,HADDOCK,LING,CODLING AND VARIOUS FLAT-FISH.
